comments:
Build I20030121

In my workspace, I have
a test.sh file
a test program

- Edit the runtime config file of a java app
- select some text from the file test.sh (something like -Djava.library.path ...)
- In the VM arguments text entry of the runtime config file, paste the selection. The 
following stack trace occasionally comes up. From there, Eclipse is in a bizarre state and 
needs to be restarted.
This may be a problem at a lower level with drag and drop - does this problem ring a 
bell?

Note that if I'm the only one who reported this kind of problem, it's possibly 
a Mac specific issue. You can reassign it to SWT. It's possible that copying 
text from a shell script on this platform has some issues.

It could be SWT-related, but the stack trace shows a problem with XML parsing. 
It could be realted (i.e. a corrput paste makes the config corrupt). Does it 
matter what you paste into the field?
Yes. It had to be copied from a shell script.
Please attach the shell script to this bug report.

Created an attachment (id=3593)
shell script

The stack trace was caused on the Mac with I20030121 by:
- opening the shell script with a standard editor in Eclipse
- copy this part:
-Djava.library.path=/Users/stephennorthover/Desktop/CHRIX_I20030121/eclipse/workspace/org.eclipse.swt.carbon/os/macosx/ppc/

- past it into the VM arguments dialog
- Apply changes

Note that I tried again on the same config and I can't reproduce the problem
anymore.
Joe, please verify that this no longer causes trouble on the Mac.

I cannot duplicate this on build 20030220.  However, I'm using Apple-C and Apple-V to 
copy and paste.  The first description of the problem mentions drag and drop.  
Christophe, is it possible to copy & paste text using drag and drop on OSX?  If so, how?
You did correctly what I did by using Apple C and Apple V.
